projects.title: Task Management REST API
projects.description: Build a complete REST API with CRUD operations, authentication, and database persistence
projects.shortDescription: REST API with authentication and database
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality task management API using Express.js/Flask/Spring Boot with user authentication, CRUD operations for tasks, input validation, error handling, and PostgreSQL/MySQL database. This project teaches API design, database integration, authentication flows, and proper backend architecture - fundamental skills for any backend role.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Project & Database
implementationSteps.description: Initialize your backend project with Express.js (Node.js), Flask (Python), or Spring Boot (Java). Set up PostgreSQL or MySQL database. Design database schema: users table (id, email, password_hash, created_at) and tasks table (id, user_id, title, description, status, due_date, created_at). Use an ORM like Sequelize, SQLAlchemy, or JPA for database operations.

implementationSteps.title: Build User Authentication
implementationSteps.description: Implement user registration endpoint (POST /api/auth/register) with password hashing using bcrypt. Create login endpoint (POST /api/auth/login) that validates credentials and returns JWT token. Build authentication middleware that verifies JWT tokens on protected routes. Store tokens securely and handle token expiration.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Task CRUD Operations
implementationSteps.description: Create RESTful endpoints: POST /api/tasks (create), GET /api/tasks (list all), GET /api/tasks/:id (get one), PUT /api/tasks/:id (update), DELETE /api/tasks/:id (delete). Each endpoint should require authentication and only return tasks belonging to the logged-in user. Add filtering and sorting: GET /api/tasks?status=completed&sort=due_date.

implementationSteps.title: Add Validation & Error Handling
implementationSteps.description: Implement request validation using libraries like express-validator, Pydantic, or Bean Validation. Validate required fields, data types, and constraints (e.g., valid email format, due_date in future). Create centralized error handler middleware that returns consistent error responses with proper HTTP status codes (400 Bad Request, 401 Unauthorized, 404 Not Found, 500 Internal Server Error).

implementationSteps.title: Testing, Documentation & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Write unit tests for API endpoints using Jest/Mocha (Node.js), pytest (Python), or JUnit (Java). Test authentication flows, CRUD operations, and error cases. Create API documentation using Swagger/OpenAPI. Add environment variables for configuration. Containerize with Docker and deploy to Heroku, Railway, or AWS. Add README with setup instructions and API examples.

projects.title: Product Catalog Microservice
projects.description: Build a scalable microservice with database, Redis caching, and proper API design
projects.shortDescription: Microservice with caching and database optimization
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-ready product catalog microservice that handles high traffic with Redis caching, database optimization, pagination, search functionality, and rate limiting. This project demonstrates performance optimization, caching strategies, and building scalable backend services - skills highly valued at product companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design Database Schema & API
implementationSteps.description: Design products table with fields: id, name, description, price, category, brand, stock, images (JSON array), created_at, updated_at. Add categories and brands tables for relationships. Create indexes on frequently queried fields (category, brand, price). Plan RESTful endpoints: GET /api/products (list with filters), GET /api/products/:id (details), POST /api/products (admin only), PUT/DELETE for admin operations.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Basic CRUD with Database
implementationSteps.description: Build product CRUD operations with proper SQL queries. Implement complex queries: search by name/description using ILIKE (PostgreSQL) or LIKE (MySQL), filter by category/brand/price range, sort by price/date. Add pagination using LIMIT and OFFSET. Use database transactions for operations that modify multiple tables. Add database connection pooling for performance.

implementationSteps.title: Add Redis Caching Layer
implementationSteps.description: Set up Redis client and implement cache-aside pattern: check cache first, if miss then query database and populate cache. Cache product details with TTL (Time To Live) of 1 hour: key format 'product:{id}'. Cache search results with shorter TTL (5 minutes): key 'products:category:{category}:page:{page}'. Implement cache invalidation on product updates/deletes. Add cache hit/miss metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Search & Filtering
implementationSteps.description: Build robust search functionality: full-text search on product name and description using database features (PostgreSQL: tsvector/tsquery, MySQL: FULLTEXT). Add filters: category, brand, price range (min-max), in-stock only. Implement multi-filter combinations with proper SQL WHERE clauses. Add sorting options: price (asc/desc), newest first, popularity. Return facet counts for filters (e.g., show '23 products in Electronics').

implementationSteps.title: Add Rate Limiting & Performance
implementationSteps.description: Implement rate limiting using Redis: store request count per IP with sliding window algorithm (100 requests per minute). Use Redis INCR with EXPIRE for simple rate limiting. Add response compression (gzip) for large payloads. Implement database query optimization: use EXPLAIN to analyze slow queries, add missing indexes. Monitor API response times and add logging for slow queries (>100ms).

implementationSteps.title: Testing & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Write integration tests covering: product CRUD operations, search and filtering, caching behavior (hit/miss), rate limiting enforcement. Use Docker Compose to run PostgreSQL + Redis + API together. Create health check endpoints: GET /health (API status) and GET /health/db (database connectivity). Deploy to cloud with environment-based configuration. Add API documentation with example requests and responses.

projects.title: Distributed Task Processing System
projects.description: Build a scalable task queue system with workers, retry logic, and monitoring dashboard
projects.shortDescription: Distributed system with message queues and workers
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a distributed task processing system using message queues (RabbitMQ/Redis Queue), multiple worker processes, retry with exponential backoff, dead letter queues, and a monitoring dashboard. This advanced project showcases distributed systems knowledge, async processing, and production-grade error handling - highly valued at top tech companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design System Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan the system: API service receives task requests and publishes to message queue (RabbitMQ/Redis Queue), Worker processes consume tasks and execute them, PostgreSQL stores task metadata and results. Design task schema: id, type, payload (JSON), status (pending/processing/completed/failed), retry_count, max_retries, created_at, completed_at, error_message. Support different task types: send_email, process_image, generate_report, webhook_call.

implementationSteps.title: Build Task Producer (API)
implementationSteps.description: Create REST API for task submission: POST /api/tasks with { type, payload, priority }. Validate task type and payload structure. Publish task to message queue with priority support (high/normal/low queues). Store task record in database with status 'pending'. Return task ID to client for tracking. Implement GET /api/tasks/:id endpoint to check task status and retrieve results.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Worker Pool
implementationSteps.description: Build worker service that connects to message queue and consumes tasks. Support running multiple worker instances for parallel processing. Each worker: fetches task from queue, updates status to 'processing', executes task handler based on task type, updates status to 'completed' or 'failed', acknowledges message. Use multi-threading or async processing for concurrent task execution within each worker.

implementationSteps.title: Add Retry Logic & Dead Letter Queue
implementationSteps.description: Implement retry mechanism: on task failure, check retry_count < max_retries, if yes: increment retry_count, re-publish to queue with exponential backoff delay (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s), if no: move to dead letter queue (DLQ). Use RabbitMQ's built-in DLQ feature or implement custom DLQ. Add task timeout: if processing exceeds threshold (e.g., 5 minutes), mark as failed and retry. Ensure idempotency: tasks should be safely retryable without side effects.

implementationSteps.title: Build Monitoring Dashboard
implementationSteps.description: Create admin dashboard showing: real-time metrics (tasks pending, processing, completed, failed), queue depth for each priority, average processing time, worker status (active/idle). Use WebSockets or SSE (Server-Sent Events) for real-time updates. Add task detail view: status, payload, error logs, retry history. Implement search and filters: by task type, status, date range. Show DLQ tasks with option to retry manually.

implementationSteps.title: Production Hardening & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Add structured logging with correlation IDs to trace tasks across services. Implement graceful shutdown for workers: finish processing current tasks before exit. Add health check endpoints for workers and queue connectivity. Set up Docker Compose for local development: API + Workers + RabbitMQ + PostgreSQL. Deploy with horizontal scaling: run multiple worker instances behind a load balancer. Add alerting for: queue depth exceeding threshold, high failure rate, workers down.
